name: places/ChIJmRwUeS9ZwokRTJa2YRC-Tao
formattedAddress: 38-64 Christopher St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 38-64 Christopher St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: This walking tour was high on my list during a trip to New York. Joe’s tour is well researched drawing on the history of exactly where the 2SLGBTQIA movement began. This is not a sugar coated version of what happened - Joe covers discrimination, violence, social ostracism, legal policies that made lives hell but focuses primarily, and rightly so, in honouring the individuals and groups who fought for change. And those still fighting for change as there’s still a lot of work to do. Thanks Joe!

text.text: This walking tour was high on my list during a trip to New York. Joe’s tour is well researched drawing on the history of exactly where the 2SLGBTQIA movement began. This is not a sugar coated version of what happened - Joe covers discrimination, violence, social ostracism, legal policies that made lives hell but focuses primarily, and rightly so, in honouring the individuals and groups who fought for change. And those still fighting for change as there’s still a lot of work to do. Thanks Joe!

originalText.text:
I enjoyed this tour with close family, including a high school age student in our family, and we  each found it to be an excellent educational primer on the movement. It inspired critical thinking about those who came together to put their lives on the line to forge the equality that some of us take for granted in the present day.

This tour seemed to be a unique and refreshing addition to the broad array of other waking tours on offer in New York.

Joe had a captivating, and engaging tour narrative that set the status quo of today’s lifestyle against the historic backdrop of institutional disenfranchisement, discrimination, and brutal police repression those who came before us experienced in the mid 20th century.

Joe conveyed a thoughtful and well-researched historic narrative as he brought us around to several places in the vicinity of Christopher Park of importance to the equality movement, and unpacked the history and the evolution of the movement up to the present day.

This tour lasted about 70 mins. I would remark that it’s suitable for families, couples, singles, students, friends, academic and professional acquaintances, and basically for anyone with an interest in social, and cultural, and political issues and their context within the history of the United States.

originalText.text: Booked this tour because I wanted to know more about Stonewall Inn and the history around it. Very interesting tour and definitely glad I visited this iconic place. I was supposed to do the tour with my boyfriend but he got sick and I got a full refund, even though I didn't cancel within 24 hours. So that was very considerate! Would definitely recommend this tour!

Would definitely recommend this tour!

originalText.text: Joe was very knowledgeable about the different places around NYC. He was enthusiastic and passionate about the stories he told us. Joe also had a sense of humor and took so pictures for us. Great tour and I would recommend it to everyone who wants to learn more about Pride.

text.text: Joe was very knowledgeable about the different places around NYC. He was enthusiastic and passionate about the stories he told us. Joe also had a sense of humor and took so pictures for us. Great tour and I would recommend it to everyone who wants to learn more about Pride.

originalText.text: What a wonderful tour! I took students from Bloomfield College, and we learned so much from our engaging, friendly, brilliant tour guide Joe. I thoroughly recommend this tour and I can't wait to bring more students. Thank you Joe!
